raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual demonstrates a strong preference for drama and feel-good television series, consistently rating shows highly, with an average rating around 4.5 or above. The appeal lies in engaging storylines, interesting characters, and a blend of humor with drama. There is a noticeable appreciation for entertaining narratives, particularly those infused with intrigue and mystery, as well as a preference for complex but relatable character dynamics.

Quality preferences often emphasize production values and acting talent, highlighting a tendency for high-rated series typically featuring well-known actors. Sentiment analysis indicates that this person enjoys shows that mix elements of suspense and comedy, suggesting a desire for entertainment that is both thought-provoking and lighthearted.

Moreover, the reviews convey a notable price sensitivity, as the individual appears wary of content with mixed ratings; positive experiences translate into repeated viewing, whereas negative reactions lead to lower ratings and reluctance to revisit. Overall, the core preferences align with a pursuit of high-quality entertainment that offers accessibility, humor, and compelling storytelling.

target_interaction.title: Better Than Morse.
target_interaction.text: Great series with nice interplay among the characters. More entertaining to me than Morse.
